post.body: Not sure how you found out that I love all things purple... but it's definitely true. :)
Hopefully your day gets better, dude. I think it's time for a cup o' tea and some jellybean relaxation. :)
Not so good, my friend. Not so good. Perhaps next year will fare better... now that I'm going to be writer and all.
Husband, you make my head hurt.
Yep, it's all a conspiracy.
Perhaps women who love Romance novels also love muscular Scotsmen? Or perhaps it's a well-concocted conspiracy!
Use twitpic! :)
Well said, Ariel. But, just out of curiosity, what prompted this?
Hah. That'd be an effective waste of my life.
That's a brilliant idea! My hair never takes the platinum so I'd be interested in seeing how it would work out for your hair.
Hubby, you always bring the lolz.
Dude, I think you have a problem with being addicted to a lame-ass TLC show.
I love that song as well. Brings back happy band-y memories.
You're doing better than us.
<3
Dude, I'm thinking of UVic and it's all your fault. Also, if we decide to move to Vic, you should help find us a place. =D
Finished with Java. Wow. I can't believe I pulled that off in two days. Whew. G'night loves!
I want my hour and a half back. What a craptastic movie. Biggest selling point: Liv Tyler. Worst selling point: Scott Speedman.
So far, "The Strangers" isn't that scary of a movie. I think it's because every time I look at Liv Tyler, I imagine her as Arwen!
Sitting in bed, programming in Java, after a morning shift at Best Buy. Such a boring nerd.
Watching Family Guy and doing Java. Damn it - when will this pain END?!
Argh. My brains.
I'm making a note here: huge success!
Back to programming for another day. Let's hope I can make this application work before the day's out.
Still Awake. But wait... what's that? I think it's a light... yes! It's a light at the end of the tunnel! For now, Starship Troopers & Java.
Getting somewhere in this project, finally. Still definitely not loving the whole Java situation.
Didn't get far in programming earlier so I'm taking another crack at it. Oi.
Programming my final project in Java and idly watching/listening to the Francis Ford Coppola version of Bram Stoker's Dracula.
Chilling out with my uncle and brother at VGH.
Going for a nap then to visit my broken uncle. My life just won't go away.
Hunting wild Linksys wireless adapter drivers.
Reinstalled Windows XP on my PC; gotta make sure that I keep this build more organized this time.
Spent the majority of my day not being near my computer; instead, I watched Shrek and Shrek 2.
Going to meet Isha for lunch. Gotta drag my butt outta bed first, I guess.
After a long day of awesomeness, I'm finally ready for sleep. With Simpsons in the background. G'night all.
Just finished watching "History of the World" while mom's sadly blitzed on Cipro and I'm drinking Breezers. Awesome noight.
Decided on trying to keep an analog journal, just to see how it goes. So far, so good.
Standing around at Office Dépôt in Sahali. Yay! I'm home again!
On my way to Kamloops after a quick pitstop at Best Buy.
Awake and mildly cold. Heading out to coffee with Heather and mom before going to visit my sister and mother-in-law. :)
Going out with Erica for dessert. Yum.
Ellen Page is amazing; I highly recommend watching "An American Crime". Disturbing but awesome.
Sitting at ther Columbia Square Starbucks. Polite service and happy folks? Sounds like home to me. *happy sigh*
On the road again. Boo.
Finishing off Christmas Cards and Newsletters while listening to Soma.fm. Hurry up and finish printing, silly newsletters.
Sitting in Juniper, designing Christmas cards and catching up online. Finally... relaxed.
Sitting in the Best Buy hub for my 15 minute break. Coca Cola heals what ails ya.
Balls. Now it's time for me to travel to work. Blah.
After a long day of driving, I'm back in Burnaby. Currently watching "Elf" and cleaning my room before work at 6.
Tonight = fail
Plan for today: drink Coke, eat BBQ chips, and roll tha d20s.
I love my Erica.
Seriously, I love Gossip Girl. I shouldn't, I know, but I do.
Awake. Holy crap and it's almost 1PM. At least I'm rested!
Stuck in traffic at the Mary Hill Bypass. Nice to see my tax dollars hard at work.
Hitting every red light thus far. I hate this place.
Heading out to Mission hopsital to visit with my uncle before I head to another shift at Best Buy. Blarg.
I'm the luckiest woman in the whole world: I have great friends, an awesome family, and the best husband that any wife could ever ask for.
I'm way too tired to be existing right now.
Conclusion: Zach and Miri Make a Porno is epic. A must see for all of yous aged 18+.
Prepping to leave Best Buy parking lot. Prep, you ask? I needs my iPod tunes, yo.
At home again... snow seems to be dwindling away into nothingness. *sigh* So much for a somewhat snowy Christmas.
Squee - I love being addressed as Mrs. Farough.
Sitting at New Westminster Toyota, waiting for my oil change to be finished.
Snow? In Vancouver? BRILLIANT! Oh wait... people can't drive in snow here. Status: doomed.
Oh hai. I iz home now.
Schizogeny is now a portal... of DOOM!
I'm seriously wondering why all of these teenage girls dress exactly the same and have the same freaking hair cut... is uniqueness dead?
All I need for Christmas is a USB hub. And possibly my two front teeth?
What a beautiful, sunshine-y day. FINALLY.
Finally heading off to bed after a few hours of creating a new writing blog.
Reformulating my blog and hoping to do some writing tonight.
Scooby Doo is all kinds of lame. Note to self: get future children to watch Dora instead.
On the skytrain. I was expecting transit delays because of the snow, but it's smooth sailing. Guess I'll peruse the mall before work.
Listening to various songs that I haven't had a chance to listen to in a long time, all the while fixing up my main blog. But work? Bleh.
Holy crap - how the heck am I going to get to work in this blizzard?
Can't believe that I actually wrote a poem. First poem in at least two years.
Resigning myself to writing for the rest of my evening. I close tomorrow night so I don't have to have an early bedtime.
Wondering when the hell I got prominent cheek bones.
Stuck in traffic on Willingdon, near BCIT. Blarg.
Coming to terms with the fact that I have no idea what I want out of my life. Except that I want to write. So, what now?
The purple has been touched up and incidentally, all I want to do is sing Christmas songs. Purple hair + Christmas songs = metal?
DAMN. It's freaking freezing down here. Bloody Vancouver weather being all like Kamloops.
Downstairs, in the gaming room, attempting some writing. Also, must research what I need for next semester's books.
On the way to Imperial Hobbies with the men of my household. Saddened because of lack of funds for Warhammers.
Java may have kicked my ass but at least working wasn't bad.
Waiting for my fate to be decided by the act of placing pen to paper and programming in the midst of my very real university test anxiety.
Status: doomed. Explanation: exam and failure to study.
Hooray! Now I've got two USB hubs working... but more cords. The sacrifices we make in the name of technogadgetry.
Hair has been repurpled and am now lounging in my brand new hot pink housecoat.
Hanging around my bedroom in my PJs and my dad's abandoned sweater that he's had for a zillion years. Planning on writing and blogging.
Awake and happy to know that I have nothing on the go for today. Perhaps a trip to the Orb store in Kits?
Enrolled in all classes and frustrated at the stupid transit system in Vancouver; it's like the whole city shuts down when it snows. Argh.
So, I didn't kill anyone and am now currently relaxing with a bubble tea and my family. *happy sigh*
Stuck at freaking Best Buy, trying not to kill customers or myself. If one more person yells at me, I'm going to snap.
More movie time with the familials after delish Christmas nom noms. Miss you hubby.
Watching Horton Hears a Who and relaxing with the family.
Hoping your Christmas day is filled with awesomeness and yultide tomfoolery.
Looking forward to seeing my folks and continuing my day of watching Avatar/cleaning my room.
Waking up to fresh steamed milk is loverly.
Finally heading home after a long day at Best Buy. Looks like they're not going to be keeping me after Christmas. *sigh*
Finding an interesting trend in housing in Victoria: it's nowhere near as expensive as it is in Vancouver.
Researching this writing degree at UVic and checking my grades from SIAT. Not only did I pass, I did VERY well.
Definitely interested in pursuing an undergraduate degree in Writing at UVic. Yay! Authoring!
Major in Writing at UVic (http://tinyurl.com/422eb4). Hmmmm... perhaps.
Finished cleaning up the kitchen and am now staring at the mess in my bedroom. Trying to determine if I should clean it now or later.
